intro: Rhodamnia fordii, commonly known as the Chinese rose or Ford's rhododendron, is a species of flowering plant native to China. It belongs to the Ericaceae family and is characterized by its dense, evergreen foliage and showy, pink to red flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 10 meters. Its flowers bloom in late spring to early summer, adding ornamental value to gardens and natural landscapes. Rhodamnia fordii prefers acidic, well-drained soils and partial to full sunlight.
